entry.title: Game: Sin & Punishment: Star Successor (Wii, 2010) (11)
entry.content:
I played for about 20 minutes tonight. I used the X-RGB with the Wii to get the input lag done. It seemed to make a difference, because I improved my performance in such a short time. This is so tough. I can't wait to beat it and go back to playing this game on an easier and more enjoyable difficulty.

Total time: 0:20

entry.title: Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (5)
entry.content: It was very interesting to read about Nouverre and his ideas. I like the expression that ballets should not be like "plays" but should be like "paintings", because with the limited language of pantomime, you can't express detailed, dynamic stories... everything has to be very extreme and relatively static to be understandable... like a painting.

entry.title: Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (4)
entry.content: The section I read today had an interesting part about how so many early French ballerinas became courtesans and changed ballet to be far more feminine.

entry.title: Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (3)
entry.content: I finished the first chapter today. It closes in an interesting way... pointing out that by the end of Louis XIV's reign ballet was established independently from the king and court but had retained in its DNA that upbringing.

entry.title: Game: Super Meat Boy (X360, 2010) (8)
entry.content:
I played 5-19X for 35 minutes today. It was brutal, but I got further than ever before... I got to the top of the tower of disappearing blocks.

Total time: 0:35
